Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 03:24PM KathyN wrote: Robin I just had my drain out today after my Stage 2 surgery.  After the first surgery in August I had four drains and remember being so relieved to get them out.  Well, it felt exactly the same today.  What a relief to not have to carry them around and empty and record them.  It really did not hurt at all. My nurse had me take a deep breath and then as i exhaled she pulled it out.  Absolutely no pain, just a funny feeling.  Good luck!!
Posts.Title: Getting the drains out robinri CathyMcD

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2008 01:37PM KathyN wrote: Hi Ladies Even though I have just started in March (acutally Feb 28th) I read your convos alot because you all have so much wisdom to share.  I will type more later, but was wondering if anyone has any suggestions for dry mouth, like a mouthwash, toothpaste, lozenges whatever.  I thought I saw something before but can't find it now. Thanks KathyN
